name: Ibuprofen
precautions: Take with food; avoid in stomach ulcers

name: Advil
precautions: Not for more than 10 days without doctor advice

name: Aspirin
precautions: Avoid in children with viral infections; bleeding risk

name: Motrin
precautions: Take every 4-6 hours; with food if stomach sensitive

name: Sudafed
precautions: May raise blood pressure; behind counter purchase

name: Robitussin DM
precautions: Drink plenty of water; do not mix with MAOIs

name: Pepto-Bismol
precautions: May darken stool/tongue; avoid with aspirin allergy

name: Imodium
precautions: Not for bacterial infections; use only 2 days

name: Tums
precautions: Limit use; can cause rebound acidity

name: Zantac
precautions: Take before meals; recall due to NDMA impurity

name: Zyrtec
precautions: Less drowsy formula; can be taken day or night

name: Allegra
precautions: Take on empty stomach; avoid fruit juices

name: NyQuil
precautions: Causes drowsiness; do not operate machinery

name: Mucinex
precautions: Drink extra fluids; helps loosen phlegm

name: Vicks VapoRub
precautions: For external use only; avoid on broken skin

name: Neosporin
precautions: For external use; stop if rash develops

name: Hydrocortisone
precautions: Do not use on face long-term; thin skin areas

name: Metformin
precautions: Take with meals; monitor kidney function

name: Atorvastatin
precautions: Take at night; avoid grapefruit juice

name: Levothyroxine
precautions: Take on empty stomach; consistent timing

name: Omeprazole
precautions: Take before meals; long-term bone risk

name: Sertraline
precautions: May worsen initially; do not stop suddenly

name: Albuterol
precautions: Shake before use; rinse mouth after

name: Amoxicillin
precautions: Take with food; finish all medication

name: Prednisone
precautions: Do not stop suddenly; taper dose

name: Sumatriptan
precautions: Use at first sign; not for prevention

name: Metoprolol
usage: High blood pressure, angina, heart failure
precautions: Do not stop abruptly; monitor pulse

name: Montelukast
precautions: May cause mood changes; take evening

name: Oxycodone
precautions: Risk of misuse; take exactly as prescribed

name: Allopurinol
precautions: Drink plenty of water; start low dose

name: Colchicine
precautions: Take at first sign; drug interactions

name: Finasteride
precautions: Women should not handle crushed tablets

name: Tamsulosin
precautions: Take after same meal daily; dizziness risk

name: Tadalafil
precautions: Daily or as needed; longer duration

name: Duloxetine
precautions: Do not open capsules; taper off

name: Pregabalin
precautions: May cause weight gain; taper slowly

name: Spironolactone
usage: Heart failure, high blood pressure, acne

name: Propranolol
precautions: Do not stop suddenly; many uses

name: Dexamethasone
precautions: Even single dose can suppress immunity

name: Budesonide
precautions: Rinse mouth after use to prevent thrush

name: Fluticasone
precautions: Takes days to work; not for immediate relief

name: Mometasone
precautions: Regular use needed for full effect

name: Fexofenadine
precautions: Take on empty stomach; avoid fruit juices

name: Meloxicam
precautions: Once daily; higher GI risk than others

name: Indomethacin
precautions: Strong NSAID; higher side effect risk

name: Ketorolac
precautions: Limit to 5 days; not for chronic use

name: Mefenamic Acid
usage: Menstrual pain, mild to moderate pain

name: Aceclofenac
precautions: Popular in some regions; COX-2 selective

name: Nimesulide
precautions: Restricted in some countries due to liver risk

name: Phenylbutazone
precautions: Rarely used due to serious blood risks
